subject: Re: Test genes, test infected rates, and test-resistant managers
msgSnippet: ... Hi Shane, Thank you for the correction.  I should have mentioned T3 developers who advance on the technical career ladder (as opposed to the managerial
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Shane Mingins" <shane.mingins@...>
> What I have seen more is that these developers become "architects"
> whom design systems in such a manner that it makes it extremely
> difficult for the T1 developer to begin developer testing. The T1
> developer is not allowed to refactor the "architecture" to aid testing
> and so to implement testing is actually very hard work and you end up
> being the only one who cares. It's very frustrating.

Hi Shane,

Thank you for the correction. I should have mentioned T3 developers
who advance on the technical career ladder (as opposed to the
managerial ladder) and become architects. T3 architects who don't
think about testability when designing the system are probably more
"harmful" than T3 managers.

Alberto

http://www.junitfactory.com
Generate JUnit tests. Free.
Send us Java. Get back JUnit.
